info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 7:06PM EDT by NWS Wilmington OH
info.description:
At 706 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 9 miles northwest of Fairview, moving east at 40 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, penny size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to vegetation. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible.
Locations impacted include... Blue Licks Battlefield, Murphysville, Burika, Alhambra, Stonewall, Mays Lick, Mitchells Mill, Rectorville, Germantown, Washington, Powersville, Peed, Helena, South Ripley, Chatham, Tuckahoe, Piqua, Hittville, US Route 62 at State Route 875, and Minerva.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building.
Motorists should slow down and use extra caution.
When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens.
Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed.
A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for northern and northeastern Kentucky...and south central and southwestern Ohio.
To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF MASON...ROBERTSON AND SOUTHERN BRACKEN COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM EDT
